Package io.artframework

Interface ArtObjectContext<TArtObject extends ArtObject>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Context, Scoped, TargetHolder
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ActionContext<TTarget>, RequirementContext<TTarget>, TriggerContext
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractArtObjectContext, DefaultActionContext, DefaultRequirementContext, DefaultTriggerContext
    public interface ArtObjectContext<TArtObject extends ArtObject>
extends Context, TargetHolder
    Every ArtObject must be wrapped inside an ArtObjectContext that controls how the ArtObject is executed or tested. It also provides a way to access the Configuration and defines a unique id that will be used to store data for the ArtObject.

    • Method Detail

      • uniqueId

        default java.lang.String uniqueId()
        Gets the unique id of this ArtObject context. The unique id is used to store metadata about the context.
        Returns:
        the unique id of this context. It will never be null or empty.

      • meta

        ArtObjectMeta<TArtObject> meta()
        Returns:
        the meta data object information for this context and art object

      • targetClass

        default java.lang.Class<?> targetClass()
        Description copied from interface: TargetHolder
        Gets the target class of this class. The target class defines a filter that is applied to all actions and checks and only the targets that match this target will be handled by this.
        Specified by:
        targetClass in interface TargetHolder
        Returns:
        the target class of this context

      • storageKey

        java.lang.String storageKey()
        Returns:
        the configured storage key of this art object context

      • storageKey

        ArtObjectContext<TArtObject> storageKey​(java.lang.String key)
        Sets the unique storage key used to identify the context from which this art object was loaded.

        The key should be generated when the art object context is created and must stay the same to retrieve the stored data.

        Parameters:
        key - the unique key of the load operation
        Returns:
        this art object context

      • store

        <TValue> java.util.Optional<TValue> store​(@NonNull
                                          @NonNull Target<?> target,
                                          @NonNull
                                          @NonNull java.lang.String key,
                                          @NonNull
                                          TValue value)
        Stores a value for the given Target and this ArtObjectContext. This means a unique key is generated from the Target.uniqueId() and uniqueId() and will be appended by your key.

        Then the StorageProvider.set(String, Object) method is called and the data is persisted.

        Use the Context.data() methods to store data that is only available in this scope and not persisted to the database.

        Type Parameters:
        TValue - type of the value
        Parameters:
        target - target to store value for
        key - storage key
        value - value to store
        Returns:
        an Optional containing the existing value
        See Also:
        StorageProvider.set(String, Object)

      • store

        <TValue> java.util.Optional<TValue> store​(@NonNull
                                          @NonNull Target<?> target,
                                          @NonNull
                                          @NonNull java.lang.String key,
                                          @NonNull
                                          @NonNull java.lang.Class<TValue> valueClass)
        Retrieves a persistently stored value from the StorageProvider and returns it cast to the given type. Will return an empty Optional if casting fails or the data does not exist.

        The data that is fetched will be stored under a unique key combination of uniqueId() and Target.uniqueId().

        Use the Context.data() methods to store data that is only available in this scope and not persisted to the database.

        Type Parameters:
        TValue - type of the value
        Parameters:
        target - target to store value for
        key - storage key
        valueClass - class of the value type you expect in return
        Returns:
        the stored value or an empty Optional if the value type cannot be cast or does not exist
